title_sort: charles l. heyde to walt whitman, october 1889
title: Charles L. Heyde to Walt Whitman, October 1889
text: U. A Woodbury Prop.Van Ness and American HotelsL. S. DrewH. N. GlarkManagersBurlington Vermont.The Van Ness House Has a Safety Hydraulic Passenger Elevator Fire Escape and the Grinnell Automatic SprinklerVan Ness HouseEViews of the Lakes and Mountains from all parts of the HouseBurlington Vt.Oct. 1889Bro Walt.Han is not quite so well—rather ambitious and tried to do as ordinarily to day—yet I think she is stronger. Weather is much against her—Chilly—sheivering[shivering]—does not see any person yet. Visitors stay too long and talk too much, whch is very distressing—I rather discourage such—indeed I am positive at times—she appreciates any thing coming from you most affectionately—keeps your letter in hand.I wish she was near Lou and George—I am at times much discouraged and too nervous to wait upon her—my apprehensions professionaly[professionally] render me often eccentric and confused—I shall be obliged perhaps to get an assistant, yet I hope not.Mention to George—My anual[annual] interest 15 dollars only is due in November—I have 10 dollars toward it—I contrive somehow—Yours trulyCharlie Charles L. Heyde to Walt Whitman, October 1889
